hackathon-description-text: The initial event in the hackathon circuit will be held at UC Berkeley and will be one of many Bay BitHack events hosted at universities throughout the Bay Area in the future. No previous experience with Bitcoin is necessary, only a desire to join the ranks of a rapidly growing number of outstanding developers and entrepreneurs building on the future of money.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Executive Director & Cofounder / College Cryptocurrency Network

hackathon-requirements:
A valid submission is a software or hardware hack produced at Bay BitHack, from start to finish. This hack must involve Bitcoin, cryptocurrency, or the blockchain in some way.
This includes a ChallengePost submission to Bay BitHack and a demonstration during the Final Round Demos on Sunday, Nov 2. 
Provide a working tech demo during your presentation. If a working demo is not available, provide a short deck to show off your concept.
hackathon-rules: All hacks must involve Bitcoin, cryptocurrency, or the blockchain in some way.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 3 BTC + guaranteed interview for an internship/new grad position at Coinbase

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Sutardja Dai Hall, University of California, Berkeley, Berkeley, CA 94709, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Success doesn't necessarily come from breakthrough innovation but from flawless execution.
Dream beyond simple API integrations. Build an ideal use case for Bitcoin or an unprecedented applications of the blockchain.
How on Earth did you pull that off in 24 hours?

hackathon-location-address: Sutardja Dai Hall, University of California, Berkeley, Berkeley, CA 94709, USA
hackathon-description-header: Bay BitHack is the first ever university hackathon dedicated to Bitcoin in the United States. Come make Bitcoin history with us.
